meanings.definition: Moving in a circle around a central point.
meanings.sent1: The merry-go-round at the park is a rotating ride.
meanings.sent2: The Earth's rotating movement creates day and night.
meanings.sent3: The rotating fan kept the room cool on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent4: The rotating planets in the solar system fascinate astronomers.
meanings.sent5: The rotating blades of the windmill generate electricity efficiently.

meanings.definition: Changing or alternating in a regular sequence.
meanings.sent1: The rotating schedule at work gives everyone a fair chance.
meanings.sent2: The rotating colors of the traffic light signal when to stop and go.
meanings.sent3: The rotating flavors of ice cream at the shop make it hard to choose.
meanings.sent4: The rotating seasons bring different weather and activities.
meanings.sent5: The rotating exhibits at the museum keep visitors engaged and interested.

meanings.definition: Turning or spinning on an axis.
meanings.sent1: The car's tires were rotating quickly on the wet road.
meanings.sent2: The windmill was rotating gracefully in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The chef was rotating the skewers of meat on the grill.
meanings.sent4: The Earth is constantly rotating on its axis.
meanings.sent5: The ballerina was rotating elegantly during her performance.
